title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: KPIT focuses on AI-driven mobility, partners with JSW
items.summary:
*KPIT aims to lead in *AI-led mobility*, emphasizing *software-defined vehicles (SDVs)*, electrification, and autonomous tech.*
- The company reported a revenue of ₹1,345 crore for June 2025, driven by autonomous, electric, and SDV programs, and formed a strategic partnership with *JSW Motors* to develop digital systems for energy vehicles.
- KPIT is heavily investing in *AI integration*, building proprietary platforms, increasing R&D, and planning to hire 2,500+ engineers to boost its global presence and technological capabilities.

items.title: Tata Steel Reports Q1 Profit Surge to ₹2,007 Crore
items.summary:
- *Tata Steel's* Q1 net profit more than doubled to **₹2,007 crore**, driven by improved India performance and reduced UK losses.
- Revenue declined slightly by 2.9%, with sales volumes dropping, but higher steel *realizations* maintained profitability.
- *UK losses narrowed*, and Dutch operations improved, while Tata Steel focused on *cost transformation* and restructuring European assets.

items.title: Envision Energy to invest ₹500 cr to boost output
items.summary:
- *Envision Energy*, a leading wind turbine manufacturer in India, plans to invest ₹500 crore to expand its manufacturing capacity. 
- The company will establish a second blade plant near Ahmedabad and a gearbox facility in Pune, aiming for a **5 GW annual production** capacity supported by a **10-12 GW order book**.
- This expansion aligns with India's renewable energy goals and local manufacturing mandates, bringing Envision's total Indian investment to ₹1,000 crore since 2016.

items.title: India manufacturing 17,000 general and non-AC coaches over 5 years: Ashwini Vaishnaw
Agentic AI to impact 1.8 crore jobs by 2030
items.summary:
- *Agentic AI* is expected to **impact over 1.8 crore jobs** in India across *manufacturing, retail,* and *education* sectors by 2030.
- The *manufacturing sector* will bear the highest impact with 80 lakh jobs affected, followed by retail with 76 lakh, and education with 25 lakh.
- While many roles will be **redefined** or **augmented** by AI, new **technology jobs** are also predicted to **create over 30 lakh opportunities** and transform existing roles through *reskilling* and *collaborative AI roles*.

items.title: Second list of solar models & manufacturers likely in 10 days
items.summary:
*India is set to publish the *second ALMM list*, detailing approved *solar models and manufacturers* within 10 days.*
- The list aims to mandate the use of *locally made solar modules* and cells for projects.
- This development supports India’s efforts to boost *local capacity* and *reduce imports* in the solar sector.*
keywords: approved list of models and manufacturers
Ministry of New and Renewable Energy

items.title: Electronics exports from India likely safe from US tariff hike—for now
items.summary:
*Indian electronics exports, including smartphones and laptops, are currently unaffected by US tariffs.*
- *The Section 232 tariffs are under review, but until then, exports continue with zero import duty.*
- *Experts believe there will be no immediate impact on Indian electronics shipments to the US.*

items.title: Virtuoso starts compressor production in Nashik
items.summary:
- *Virtuoso Optoelectronics Ltd*, through its subsidiary, has launched **reciprocating compressor** manufacturing at a new facility in Nashik.
- The plant can produce **2.8 million units annually**, catering to domestic and international refrigeration needs.
- This strategic move marks a significant step in *Virtuoso's* expansion in *component manufacturing* for the *white goods industry*, with collaborations ensuring high-quality standards.

items.title: Axis Solutions lists on BSE post merger
items.summary:
- *Axis Solutions* has completed its merger and started trading on the *Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE)*.
- The company, specializing in *industrial automation* and *digital infrastructure*, aims for *growth* in sectors like *oil & gas*, water infrastructure, and digitalization.
- Its listing is seen as a milestone, boosting *visibility* and *investor engagement*, and supporting *India’s industrial and sustainability goals*.

items.title: Bharat Forge to establish ring mill for aerospace applications
Trump announces 25% tariff on India starting Friday, unspecified penalties for buying Russian energy
Meghalaya CM inaugurates NE's biggest bottling plant in Mendipathar
India's wind energy capacity rises to 51.67 GW, Gujarat, TN & Karnataka lead
Indian Contract Manufacturers Go Global
items.summary:
- *Indian electronic contract manufacturers* are expanding globally through acquisitions and partnerships, leveraging *tariff-related supply chain disruptions*.
- They are acquiring technologies and capabilities quickly, aligning with the Indian government's push to boost domestic electronics exports.
- *Investors* are cautious about the ongoing wave of acquisitions, fearing *delayed ROI* and capital misallocation risks.

items.title: Nissan takes a $535 million quarterly hit, as tariffs bite
Thailand adjusts EV policy to ease production requirements, target exports
Candy giant Mars to invest $2 billion more in US manufacturing through 2026
Tata Motors set to acquire Italian truck maker Iveco for $4.5 billion in its biggest deal to date
Early rains pour cold water on FMCG cos' summer biz
Over 15 GW Rooftop Solar Systems Installed in India
items.summary:
- India has installed *15,206 MW* of grid-connected rooftop solar systems over the past five years.
- The total *non-fossil fuel-based electricity generation capacity* in India has reached *242.78 GW*.
- The government promotes domestic solar manufacturing through a *₹24,000 crore production-linked incentive scheme*.
keywords: PM Surya Ghar Muft Bijli Yojana

items.title: L&T’s Hydrocarbon Offshore Arm Secures ₹15,000 Crore Order
items.summary:
- L&T’s offshore hydrocarbon arm gained an *ultra-mega order* exceeding ₹15,000 crore from a Middle Eastern client.
- The project includes *engineering, procurement, construction,* and *installation* of various offshore structures and upgrades to existing facilities.
- L&T emphasized the contract reflects their commitment to delivering complex projects with *world-class safety standards*.

items.title: Make in India 2.0: MSMEs go global
items.summary:
- *Indian MSMEs* are the backbone of the economy but mostly cater to domestic markets.
- *Going global* requires MSMEs to overcome regulatory challenges, access finance, and build international trust.
- A *new generation of MSMEs* with international exposure and innovative thinking can unlock India's potential in global manufacturing.

**Key factors** include government support via policies that focus on *region-specific* and *inclusive* growth, along with MSMEs adopting *branding, digitalization,* and *scaling strategies* to compete internationally.

items.title: Asia Investments UK and Anevolve Acquire Majority Stake in APAG
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- *Asia Investments UK* and *Anevolve* will acquire a **63%** stake in *APAG Holding AG*, a Swiss automotive electronics firm.
- The deal includes a **capital infusion** into APAG and aims for complete ownership by **2029-30**.
- *APAG* specializes in *electronic control units* and serves major OEMs, projecting a turnover of **$93 million** for FY ending March 2025.

items.title: Venttup's Whitepaper on India’s Manufacturing Sector
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- Venttup's whitepaper **examines** India's manufacturing landscape and proposes strategies for growth.
- Key insights include the rise of **Manufacturing as a Service** and the potential for India's aircraft component market to reach **$29.5 billion by 2033**.
- Recommendations emphasize building industrial corridors, workforce development, and increased adoption of **Industry 4.0** technologies.

items.title: Chips as the New Engines of Vehicles
items.author: Mukul Yudhveer Singh, ETManufacturing
items.summary:
- *Semiconductor chips* have become the heart of modern vehicles, redefining what a car is.  
- The shift to software-defined vehicles emphasizes real-time decision-making and *AI integration* powered by chips.  
- India is positioning itself as a key player in *automotive technology development*, contributing to global innovations.

items.title: How Hyundai is Using AI in Manufacturing and Mobility
items.author: Ramarko Sengupta, ETEnterpriseAI
items.summary:
- Hyundai integrates *AI* across manufacturing, enhancing efficiency and quality in operations.
- The *Bluelink platform* offers personalized, AI-driven connected mobility for over 675,000 vehicles in India.
- In collaboration with local institutions, Hyundai is developing innovative solutions focused on *sustainable mobility* and customer experience.

items.title: Trump suggests 20-25% tariff for India
items.summary:
- President *Trump* mentioned a potential *20-25% tariff* for India, lower than the previously announced 26%.
- The tariff discussions occur as both countries approach a *August 1 deadline* for a trade deal.
- India is currently engaged in trade negotiations while maintaining high tariffs on certain products, affecting their position in the global market compared to countries like *Bangladesh* and *Vietnam*.

items.title: MAN Industries Raises ₹255 Crore for Expansion
items.author: ET Infra Desk
items.summary:
- MAN Industries has raised ₹255 crore through *preferential allotment* from institutional investors.
- Funds will support expansions in *Jammu and Saudi Arabia* and improve operational resilience.
- The successful fundraising reflects confidence in the company's **growth strategy** and commitment to infrastructure opportunities.

items.title: Electronics Makers Seek Global Partnerships
items.author: Subhrojit Mallick, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- Indian electronics manufacturers are acquiring and partnering with global firms to access Western markets amid tariff uncertainties. 
- The shift aligns with the Indian government's aim for self-sufficiency and increased exports in electronics. 
- Major players like Amber Group and Dixon Technologies are investing heavily in acquisitions to enhance capabilities and meet global demand, especially in defense and consumer electronics.

items.title: PE Funds Compete for Sensa Core Majority Stake
items.author: Reghu Balakrishnan, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- *Private equity firms* like KKR and TPG are discussing acquiring a majority stake in Sensa Core, a leading Indian medical device manufacturer.
- The potential valuation of Sensa Core could be around *$300 million*, highlighting growing interest in the *Indian medical devices sector*.
- India's medtech market is set for substantial growth, projected to expand from *$12 billion to $50 billion* by 2030, with a rising global market share.

items.title: IMF raises India's growth forecast to 6.4% for FY26
items.summary:
- The **IMF** has upgraded India's economic growth forecast to *6.4%* for both FY26 and FY27, citing a more favorable external environment.  
- This projection is slightly below the *Reserve Bank of India's* estimate of *6.5%* for FY26.  
- Global growth is also expected to rise, with the IMF projecting *3%* growth for 2025 and *3.1%* for 2026.

items.title: Doosan Robotics Acquires ONExia to Boost AI Strategy
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- Doosan Robotics has acquired an *89.59% stake* in US-based ONExia for **$25.9 million**, enhancing its AI-driven robotics capabilities.
- This acquisition aligns with Doosan's strategic pivot from **hardware to software-led solutions**.
- The move aims to strengthen Doosan's position in the *intelligent robotics* market and leverage ONExia's automation expertise.

items.title: Strategic Benefits of Make in India and Atmanirbhar Bharat
items.author: Nishant Kashyap
items.summary:
- The *construction equipment sector in India* is poised for growth, driven by government initiatives like Make in India and Atmanirbhar Bharat.  
- With significant investments in *infrastructure*, key areas such as roads and urban projects are expected to spur demand for construction equipment.  
- ACE is committed to innovation and has adapted to evolving customer expectations that emphasize sustainability and efficiency.

items.title: Reliance Consumer in Talks for Stake in Shunya Drinks
items.author: Ratna Bhushan, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- *Reliance Consumer Products* is negotiating to acquire a majority stake in *Baidyanath Group's* Shunya brand, known for zero-sugar beverages.
- This move aims to tap into the growing demand for *healthy functional drinks*, competing with major brands like Coca-Cola and PepsiCo.
- Successful completion would be Reliance's fourth acquisition in the beverage sector, enhancing its portfolio in the health-oriented market segment.

items.title: European pharma industry still worried about tariffs
Firefly Aerospace Revving Up for $5.5 Billion IPO
items.summary:
- *Firefly Aerospace* aims for a $5.5 billion valuation in its upcoming IPO, planning to raise up to **$632 million** by selling 16.2 million shares priced between $35 and $39.
- The U.S. IPO market is recovering in 2025, fostering renewed investor interest in high-growth sectors, including space technology.
- With strategic investments and partnerships, Firefly's IPO taps into the booming commercialization of space and defense sectors.

items.title: US-EU Aerospace Rivalry: Tariff-Free Aircraft Trade Deal
items.summary:
- A *provisional deal* between the U.S. and EU establishes *zero tariffs* on aircraft and parts, averting trade tensions.  
- The agreement reflects unusual unity among rivals Airbus and Boeing, previously embroiled in a *17-year dispute*.  
- Industry officials remain cautious, awaiting the detailed implementation of the deal and its implications for future trade relations.

items.title: CNOOC Starts Gas Production at New South China Sea Block
items.summary:
* CNOOC Ltd has commenced gas production from the **Dongfang 1-1 field** in the **South China Sea**.  
* This site is China's first offshore high-temperature, high-pressure natural gas project located in the **Yinggehai Basin** at a depth of 67 meters.  
* The project aims for a peak output of about **35 million cubic feet** daily by 2026, supplying gas to **Guangdong**, **Hainan**, and **Hong Kong**.

items.title: Arvind Posts 35% Profit Rise Amid Shift from China
items.summary:
- *Arvind* reported a **35%** increase in first-quarter profit due to brands shifting sourcing from *China* to *India*.
- The company achieved a consolidated profit of **532.4 million** Indian rupees, with revenue growing by **10%** to **20.06 billion** rupees.
- Geopolitical tensions and *Bangladesh's* political turmoil are driving global brands to diversify, though Arvind faces challenges from **higher input costs** and U.S. tariffs.

items.title: Meghalaya CM Sangma inaugurates latex manufacturing unit
items.summary:
- Chief Minister Conrad K Sangma inaugurated the *Centrifuged Latex Manufacturing Unit* in East Garo Hills, marking a key development for local farmers.
- The unit aims to support approximately *3,000 farmers* involved in rubber plantations and enhance entrepreneurship in the region.
- It is the *first* of its kind in Meghalaya and aims to improve farmers' livelihoods by providing better prices for their raw rubber, while also reducing reliance on middlemen.

items.title: EV boom drives salary surge in auto sector: Report
items.author: ETAuto Desk
items.summary:
- The Indian *auto sector*, especially in *electric vehicles* (EVs), anticipates a notable salary increase of **11.3%** in FY26, the highest among industries.
- Demand for *skilled professionals* in technical and engineering roles is on the rise due to the shift towards sustainable mobility and substantial investment in the EV ecosystem.
- The report highlights significant salary growth not only in EV sectors but also in related fields like consumer durables and IT, underscoring the sector's evolving landscape.

items.title: India-UK Free Trade Deal Boosts Tyre Exports
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- The new India-UK trade agreement removes *import duties* on tyres, enhancing the competitiveness of *Indian tyre manufacturers* in the UK market.
- Tyre exports from India to the UK saw an *11% increase* in FY25, and the industry anticipates further growth with the elimination of tariffs.
- The deal enables immediate gains for Indian exporters while ensuring a *phased reduction of tariffs* on UK tyre imports over ten years.

items.title: India’s green steel demand to soar to 179 mt by 2050: EY Parthenon
Musashi India Opens Technology Excellence Centre
items.author: ETAuto Desk
items.summary:
- *Musashi India* has inaugurated the *Musashi Technology Excellence Centre (MTEC)* in Bengaluru with an initial investment of ₹10 crore.
- The centre will focus on developing next-generation *energy storage systems* and enhancing *e-mobility technologies* tailored to the Indian market.
- MTEC aims to attract engineering talent and support India's *Net Zero 2030 ambitions* while streamlining product development processes.

items.title: Andhra Pradesh approves JSW AP Steel plant
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- The *Andhra Pradesh government* has approved an *integrated steel plant* in Kadapa district by JSW AP Steel Limited.
- The project will unfold in two phases with a total investment of ₹20,850 crore, starting in January 2026.
- The government will allocate land and resources, supporting infrastructure for this major *industrial development*.

items.title: Showroom B2B Opens New Apparel Manufacturing Facility
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
* Showroom B2B has launched a new apparel manufacturing facility in Noida, increasing monthly production capacity by 150,000 garments.
* The venture aims to generate $8 million in annual revenue, creating over 300 jobs while focusing on employing women.
* The facility is part of a strategic five-year plan targeting ₹2,500 crore in revenue, emphasizing efficiency and responsiveness in production.

items.title: India's Finished Steel Imports Down Nearly 30% in Q1 FY26
items.author: ET Infra Desk
items.summary:
- India's finished steel imports fell by *28.8%* in Q1 FY26, with 1.4 million metric tonnes imported.
- Sharp declines in imports from *China* (down 45.8%) and *Japan* (down 65.2%) occurred following a safeguard tariff.
- South Korea remains the largest exporter, while India's crude steel production rose by *11.2%* during the same period.

items.title: Tata Elxsi and KAVIA AI Partner for GenAI in Software Dev
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- *Tata Elxsi* partners with **KAVIA AI** to enhance the *software development lifecycle* with *generative AI automation*.  
- This collaboration focuses on improving processes such as planning, coding, and quality assurance for enterprise applications.  
- Industries targeted include *transportation*, *media*, and *healthcare*, aiming for higher efficiency and reliability.

items.title: Procter & Gamble appoints Shailesh Jejurikar as CEO
items.summary:
- *Shailesh Jejurikar*, currently COO, will become P&G's CEO on January 1, 2026, succeeding Jon Moeller.
- Jejurikar has been integral to P&G, greatly influencing its *Fabric Care and Home Care* sectors.
- His leadership is expected to drive *sustained growth and value creation* for the company.

items.title: Godrej's ₹1200 Crore Digital Transformation Investment
items.author: Nishant Kashyap
items.summary:
- Godrej Enterprises Group is investing ₹1200 crore over three years to enhance *digital transformation* in manufacturing.
- The focus includes factory automation, the development of their own *Manufacturing Execution System*, and AI applications for improved decision-making.
- Emphasizing *MSME digitization*, the firm plans significant AI training to support their suppliers and address the growing digital maturity challenge in India.
